SEARCH
Package au.csiro.pathling.views

Class FhirViewBuilder

java.lang.Object
au.csiro.pathling.views.FhirViewBuilder
public class FhirViewBuilder extends Object
Builder class for creating FhirView instances.

This builder provides a fluent interface for constructing FHIR views with various components such as resource types, constants, select clauses, and where conditions. The builder follows the builder pattern, allowing method chaining for convenient configuration.

Usage example: 


 FhirView view = new FhirViewBuilder()
     .resource("Patient")
     .constant("birthYear", new IntegerType(1990))
     .select(SelectClause.of("name", "name.given"))
     .where("birthDate >= %birthYear")
     .build();
Author:
John Grimes

  • Method Details

    • name

      public FhirViewBuilder name(@Nullable String name)
      Sets the name for this view.

      This is an optional field that provides a computer-friendly name for the view.

      Parameters:
      name - the name for the view
      Returns:
      this builder instance for method chaining

    • resource

      public FhirViewBuilder resource(@NotNull @NotNull String resource)
      Sets the FHIR resource type for this view.

      This is a required field that specifies which FHIR resource type the view will operate on. Common examples include "Patient", "Observation", "Condition", etc.

      Parameters:
      resource - the FHIR resource type name (e.g., "Patient", "Observation")
      Returns:
      this builder instance for method chaining
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if resource is null

    • constant

      public FhirViewBuilder constant(@Nonnull ConstantDeclaration... constant)
      Adds one or more constant declarations to the view.

      Constants can be referenced in FHIRPath expressions using the % prefix (e.g., %myConstant). This is useful for parameterizing queries or providing reusable values.

      Parameters:
      constant - one or more constant declarations to add
      Returns:
      this builder instance for method chaining

    • constant

      public FhirViewBuilder constant(@Nonnull String name, @Nonnull IBase value)
      Adds a constant declaration with the specified name and value.

      This is a convenience method for creating a constant declaration inline. The constant can be referenced in FHIRPath expressions using %name.

      Parameters:
      name - the name of the constant (used with % prefix in expressions)
      value - the FHIR value to associate with this constant
      Returns:
      this builder instance for method chaining

    • select

      public FhirViewBuilder select(@Nonnull SelectClause... select)
      Adds one or more select clauses to the view.

      Select clauses define what data should be extracted from the FHIR resources. Each clause typically consists of a column name and a FHIRPath expression.

      Parameters:
      select - one or more select clauses to add
      Returns:
      this builder instance for method chaining

    • where

      public FhirViewBuilder where(@Nonnull WhereClause... where)
      Adds one or more where clauses to the view.

      Where clauses define filtering conditions that resources must satisfy to be included in the view results. Each clause contains a FHIRPath expression that evaluates to a boolean.

      Parameters:
      where - one or more where clauses to add
      Returns:
      this builder instance for method chaining

    • where

      public FhirViewBuilder where(@Nonnull String... where)
      Adds one or more where conditions as strings.

      This is a convenience method for adding where clauses when you only need to specify the condition expression without a description.

      Parameters:
      where - one or more FHIRPath condition expressions
      Returns:
      this builder instance for method chaining

    • where

      public FhirViewBuilder where(@Nonnull String condition, @Nullable String description)
      Adds a where condition with an optional description.

      The description can be used for documentation purposes or to provide context about what the condition is checking for.

      Parameters:
      condition - the FHIRPath expression that defines the filtering condition
      description - optional human-readable description of the condition
      Returns:
      this builder instance for method chaining

    • build

      public FhirView build()
      Builds and returns a new FhirView instance with the configured settings.

      This method validates that all required fields are set and creates the final view object. The resource type must be set before calling this method.

      Returns:
      a new FhirView instance configured with the builder's settings
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the resource type has not been set
